body:
@jonkerj Can you please take a look on this one? Already checked on running environment and when I added variable to deployment on cluster I was able to get more than 800 results.
      env:
        [...some other envs...]
        - name: JAVA_OPTS
          value: '-Xms128m -Xmx512m -XX:+ExitOnOutOfMemoryError'
Would you open a PR for this?

> 

This is great, I just tried it and it works fine. 

Thanks!
This MR seems dormant, is anyone still working on it?

This will be a great feature. I saw signoz has this feature, it's called "Trace Graph"

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/819587/155882830-7aa5e74f-61a6-4410-aa30-f9de16eed4f7.png)

I think is very useful to get the big picture of your request. Then you can use the tree graph for details.

Are you up to taking it over?

FYI, there's a fix waiting in PR for this issue: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3437

Zipkin Server shouldn't be vulnerable since it is packaged as a jar file and uses Armeria's embedded server. Likewise, zipkin-gcp would not be affected.
Upgrading the Spring Boot version two minors is not going to be as simple as changing the version in the POM. Looks like some tests are failing. I don't have time to look into this now, unfortunately. I'll try to come back to this if I do have time, but someone else feel free to work on it.

The blog post mentions the conditions for being impacted by the vulnerability. I don't think Zipkin Server is vulnerable because it is packaged as a jar and does not even use Tomcat. So, this CVE isn't applicable to Zipkin unless I'm missing something.

> The blog post mentions the conditions for being impacted by the vulnerability. I don't think Zipkin Server is vulnerable because it is packaged as a jar and does not even use Tomcat. So, this CVE isn't applicable to Zipkin unless I'm missing something.

We use zipkin by offical docker <https://zipkin.io/pages/quickstart.html>.
And this image has this problem。

> Interesting. Did you use a specific policy? Maybe making the index read-only was causing issues? But it's just a wild guess.

Sorry for my late response. I don't have access to that environment anymore.

When running Zipkin via the docker image, it is also not packaged as a war file and it is not run on a standalone Tomcat, so I don't see how it is vulnerable. The Zipkin Server exec jar is extracted and run with `java -cp`: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/8a4f4b9c9a5a3204d9663ecef39d687785369c9a/docker/start-zipkin#L41-L43
What makes you think the Zipkin docker image is vulnerable?

ok,i should take time to review the history commits of changes.
I try it ,thanks very much.
ANy news on this?
Can you elaborate your ideas on how to achieve that?
same problem with me. I'm planning to switch my elasticsearch version into 7.9 and try again.

Was anyone able to find a work around this? Are there any MRs which are able to support hourly indices?
Any help on above would be really appreciated

If Zipkin can write to an alias (without any date math) then you could set that up with with ILM (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/overview-index-lifecycle-management.html) in the background. That this was part of Zipkin is probably more for historic reasons when Elasticsearch lacked any such features, but things have luckily changed by now.
We see the same thing. I'm pretty sure it's a bug. But I'm not so sure it will be fixed since the activity level in this project is really low :/

> ANy news on this?

Sorry with a late response, I find it happened when zipkin client is in an old version which has json array in span data, like below:

```json
{
                    "timestamp_millis": 1648189127998,
                    "_q":
                    [
                        "http.method",
                        "http.method=GET",
                        "http.path",
                        "http.path=/getId",
                        "mvc.controller.class",
                        "mvc.controller.class=IdCenterController",
                        "mvc.controller.method",
                        "mvc.controller.method=getId"
                    ],
                    "traceId": "9cc28a3ad42757af",
                    "parentId": "9cc28a3ad42757af",
                    "id": "6ecb2ed650bb52c8",
                    "kind": "SERVER",
                    "name": "get /getid",
                    "timestamp": 1648189127998059,
                    "duration": 717,
                    "localEndpoint":
                    {
                        "serviceName": "id-center-service",
                        "ipv4": "*.*8.*4.*0"
                    },
                    "remoteEndpoint":
                    {
                        "ipv4": "*.*8.*4.*0"
                    },
                    "tags":
                    {
                        "http.method": "GET",
                        "http.path": "/getId",
                        "mvc.controller.class": "IdCenterController",
                        "mvc.controller.method": "getId"
                    },
                    "shared": true
                }
```

when _q gets parsed, NullPointerException happened.
I change my es version into 7.9.3, and this problem is gone. You can try it.
I'd rather first add the ES options and leave extraEnv out of this PR.

Thanks for reaching out. Unfortunately we don't support custom builds and
that is what I understand you are trying to achieve.

The jump to 2.6.6 is actually pretty big, but 2.5.13 also has the vulnerability fixes.  I put in a pull req to update to 2.5.13 and spring to 5.3.20.  All tests pass in my local IntelliJ

I know zipkin is probably not vulnerable to 22965, the problem is this note at the end of the advisory:
"However, the nature of the vulnerability is more general, and there may be other ways to exploit it."
So my organization is mandating we update the version to remediate this.
All tests are passing in my local

Thanks Carlos, do you have a example/document how collector can be used for this issue? I was looking at https://zipkin.io/pages/architecture.html but couldn't find details around collector usage to redact info.

OK this just looks like the mysql version needs to be updated.  I'll add another commit. I don't have the docker tests running on my local unfortunately, they seem to need docker installed. Hopefully everything will pass then

You can use something like https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/tree/main/processor/transformprocessor with an open telemetry collector but to be honest i looks like too much burden. You can also create your own processor where you redact those tags: receiver zipkin -> custom processor -> exporter zipkin.
Thanks Carlos, where I find Zipkin documentation for creating custom processor. Any example/tutorial etc. will be very helpful.

Unfortunately my organization blocks github so i'm doing this on a personal iMac i don't normally do development with.
How solve it? Thank you~!

I had exactly same problem. The reason it doesn't work is missing java module `java.security.jgss`. If you create a container from image `ghcr.io/openzipkin/java:15.0.5_p3` (used by https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/docker/Dockerfile), you'll notice that `java --list-modules` doesn't return `java.security.jgss`. I am not sure but it seems that JDK used by image isn't complete or lighter version is used without additional modules.

I have solved problem by creating my own Dockerfile:
```
FROM openzipkin/zipkin:2.23.16 as zipkin

FROM amazoncorretto:18-alpine

COPY --from=zipkin /usr/local/bin/ /usr/local/bin/

ARG USER=zipkin

WORKDIR /${USER}

RUN adduser -g '' -h ${PWD} -D ${USER}

COPY --from=zipkin --chown=${USER} /zipkin/ /zipkin/

USER ${USER}

RUN cd BOOT-INF/lib && wget https://github.com/aws/aws-msk-iam-auth/releases/download/v1.1.4/aws-msk-iam-auth-1.1.4-all.jar

ENTRYPOINT ["start-zipkin"]
```

Btw. I decided to use amazoncorretto with latest Java 18 version

CVE-2022-22965 is found in docker image.

Automated scans fail on: 
/zipkin/BOOT-INF/lib/spring-beans-5.3.13.jar
/zipkin/BOOT-INF/lib/spring-core-5.3.13.jar

Pull Request  -  https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3457
@jcchavezs
@jcchavezs , will you be able to provide any feedback on this pls.

From the CVE you linked:

> These are the prerequisites for the exploit:
> -  JDK 9 or higher
> -  Apache Tomcat as the Servlet container
> -  Packaged as WAR
> -  spring-webmvc or spring-webflux dependency

As I mentioned in my previous comment, the Zipkin server is neither packaged as a WAR nor does it use Tomcat as the Servlet container, therefore it is not vulnerable to that CVE.

So it does not look like the problem related to zipkin jar file itself. The scope is container image. It looks like official docker image (openzipkin/zipkin) contains other vulnerable jars:
/zipkin/BOOT-INF/lib/spring-beans-5.3.13.jar
/zipkin/BOOT-INF/lib/spring-core-5.3.13.jar

That's why whole docker image is blocked by security scanners. In my case it is Aquasec.
Anyway, I'm unable to use official docker image as deployment method.
I'm really blocked and will appreciate the fix in the docker image.
Up for a PR?

> Up for a PR?

Sorry?

I am sorry I wasn't unclear. Are you up to work on a PR that fixes this
issue?

I have the same issue on k8s in this two months(first time deploy in March 2022, everything was ok), all logs about LoggingClient for es api are UNKNOWN host like this "http://UNKNOWN/#GET", then I have change logger level to debug, and dns resolver is ok. i once thought it is a es problem, but other es clients are working.
During debugging I find something confusing that is when zipkin server started and connected es failed, then i restart one pod of es cluster node, zipkin server would work again, LoggingClient logs ES_HOSTS not UNKNOWN, but if i restart zipkin server this issue will come again.

> Shall we close this then?

I think this pr can fix NullPointerExceptin when zipkin client in old version but zipkin server in new version, and zipkin client is integrated in business project which means it‘s not an easy thing to update, but zipkin server is an independent service which means it's easy to update.

I hope you can accept this pr.

@jcchavezs I have created #3467 trying to fix this. waiting for your opinion. Thanks

The issue was caused by an incorrect definition of spans.
Some spans were created but not started and not finished in the finally clause. 
By fixing the code creating the spans, the issue disappeared.

Thanks!

On Mon, 15 Aug 2022, 06:27 Craig Ringer, ***@***.***> wrote:

> Describe the Bug
>
> CVE-2022-37434 affects the Alpine base image used by the openzipkin/zipkin
> images on Docker Hub.
>
> See
>
>    - "Alpine 3.13.12, 3.14.8 and 3.15.6 released"
>    <https://security.alpinelinux.org/vuln/CVE-2022-37434>
>    - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-ALPINE316-ZLIB-2976176
>    - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-37434
>    - http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-37434
>
> Steps to Reproduce
>
> Scan openzipkin/zipkin with Trivy or Snyk
> Expected Behaviour
>
> Base Alpine image updated to >= 3.13.12, 3.14.8 or 3.15.6
> Notes
>
> I looked in the git repo for anything matching with git grep -E
> '\<v?3\.1[3456]\>' but didn't see where the actual built-with alpine
> version for the non-test images comes from, so I wasn't able to immediately
> make this into a pull request.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/3470>, or unsubscribe

The override main response setting compatibility.override_main_response_version is deprecated from OpenSearch version 1.x and removed from OpenSearch 2.0.0. This setting is no longer supported for compatibility with legacy clients.

@emanzat the change is indeed deprecated, was removed and reverted later on [1], it should be there for 2.x but very likely not in 3.x.

[1] https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/pull/3530

> I have the same issue on k8s in this two months(first time deploy in March 2022, everything was ok), all logs about LoggingClient for es api are UNKNOWN host like this "http://UNKNOWN/#GET", then I have change logger level to debug, and dns resolver is ok. i once thought it is a es problem, but other es clients are working. During debugging I find something confusing that is when zipkin server started and connected es failed, then i restart one pod of es cluster node, zipkin server would work again, LoggingClient logs ES_HOSTS not UNKNOWN, but if i restart zipkin server this issue will come again.

I find that might be alpine base image network issues on kubernetes. I have repackage zipkin image with eclipse-temurin ubuntu base image, and it works. I find that more and more libraries running on jvm alpine base image that will have network issues since kubernetes 1.24-1.25 (1.24 in last comment), some components like spring config server, spring config client, some libraries like spring resttemplate, jgit. In my team, since kubernetes being upgraded, almost all projects need to be repackaged from alpine base to non-alpine.
So, does the openzipkin team consider providing non-alpine base image as an option?
@jcchavezs Could you please clarify whether Zipkin is going to support MySQL 8 in near future?
Sure, let me check.

Hi people. Thanks for showing interest on this feature. At the moment I don't think we have enough capacity to support a new storage in the core repo. How about moving this code to a repository where people can consume and try out and then when prooved to work we move to the contrib section?

In my experience working out a storage implementation isn't an easy task and hence we better do it carefuly.

实验得出：
1. zipkin docker 不能使用 mysql 8.0.28，可以使用mysql 8.0.17;
2. 可以通过直接运行 zipkin.jar 使用  mysql 8.0.28。

zipkin.jar来源：
https://zipkin.io/quickstart.sh
得到zipkin.jar，再单独打成docker运行可行。

Comming back to this again I do think it would be good to include the security module in the JVM you bundle with zipkin, simply trying to turn on the security module doesn't work as it doesn't exist in the jre you bundle

I ended up downloading the latest jar and creating a new image with a different base JVM
these are the missing files: jmods/java.security.jgss.jmod and java.security.sasl.jmod 

sizes in KB:
656     /usr/lib/jvm/java-17-openjdk-amd64/jmods/java.security.jgss.jmod
88      /usr/lib/jvm/java-17-openjdk-amd64/jmods/java.security.sasl.jmod

That sounds like it could be reasonable to include if we're not increasing the size by a significant amount - I'd be curious about a % increase in image size. Would you be interested in sending a pull request and providing that comparison?
